links: Moshe Levin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = n(n+1)(2n+1)/6 (mod n). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 28 2011(NB: This does not mean a(n) = n(n+1)(2n+1)/6 mod n !) - _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 21 2013
example: a(5) = 1^2 + 2^2 + (3^2 mod 5) + (4^2 mod 5) + (5^2 mod 5) = 1 + 4 + 4 + 1 + 0 = 10. (It is easily seen that the last term, n^2 mod n, is always zero and would not need to be included.) - _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 21 2013
